title: Age of Exploration: Colonization and Global Trade

vocab.definition: Period of European overseas expansion and discovery (1400s-1600s)
Establishing settlements and political control over distant territories
Economic theory that national wealth depends on accumulating gold and favorable trade
Spanish explorer and conqueror in the Americas
Transfer of plants, animals, and diseases between Old and New Worlds

teachingNotes: Discuss motivations for exploration and consequences for indigenous peoples. Analyze the global impact of European expansion.

sample.question: What was the period of European overseas expansion called?
What is the Columbian Exchange?
expectedAny: transfer between Old and New Worlds

sample.question: When was the Age of Exploration?
What was exchanged in Columbian Exchange?

truefalse.question: Mercantilism believed national wealth depended on accumulating gold. (True or False)
Colonization meant exploring without settling. (True or False)
The Age of Exploration was in the 1400s-1600s. (True or False)
Conquistadors were Spanish explorers. (True or False)
The Columbian Exchange transferred ideas only. (True or False)
Europeans sought gold and trade routes. (True or False)
Colonization established political control. (True or False)
Mercantilism opposed favorable trade. (True or False)
The Columbian Exchange involved plants and animals. (True or False)
Exploration had no impact on indigenous peoples. (True or False)

multiplechoice.question: What were Spanish explorers in the Americas called?
What economic theory emphasized gold accumulation?
What period was the Age of Exploration?
What was exchanged between Old and New Worlds?
What is a settlement with political control?

fillintheblank.question: The period of European overseas expansion was the Age of _____.
_____ means establishing settlements with political control.
_____ believed national wealth depended on gold.
The _____ Exchange transferred plants and animals between worlds.
The Age of Exploration was in the _____s to _____s.
The Columbian Exchange involved the _____ and New Worlds.

shortanswer.question: What was the Age of Exploration?
expectedAny: Period of European overseas expansion from 1400s-1600s
Time when Europeans explored and discovered new lands
Era of European discovery and colonization

shortanswer.question: What is colonization?
expectedAny: Establishing settlements and political control over distant territories

shortanswer.question: What is mercantilism?
expectedAny: Economic theory that national wealth depends on gold and favorable trade
System emphasizing accumulation of wealth through trade
Economic policy of accumulating gold and exports

shortanswer.question: Who were conquistadors?
expectedAny: Spanish explorers and conquerors in the Americas
Spanish conquistadors who conquered New World

shortanswer.question: What was the Columbian Exchange?
expectedAny: Transfer of plants animals and diseases between Old and New Worlds
Biological and cultural exchange after Columbus

shortanswer.question: Why did Europeans explore?
expectedAny: To find gold trade routes and spread Christianity
For wealth resources and religious expansion
Seeking riches and new trade opportunities

shortanswer.question: What did colonization achieve?
expectedAny: Established settlements with political control over resources
Created colonies for economic and political benefit
Extended European power to distant territories

shortanswer.question: How did mercantilism work?
expectedAny: Emphasized exports over imports to accumulate gold

shortanswer.question: What impact did exploration have?
expectedAny: Devastating impact on indigenous peoples through disease and colonization
Transformed both Old and New Worlds

shortanswer.question: What was exchanged?
expectedAny: Crops animals and diseases between continents
Biological exchange including plants livestock and pathogens
Food animals and diseases crossed oceans
